title: "ARAM MMR" - Do any rough approximation sites exist?
body:
I have a friend who mainly only plays ARAM, not liking other more serious game modes. 
Although unranked himself, he is getting matched with Plats and Diamonds consistently in his matches.

Is there anyway for him to check some sort of "ARAM MMR" on a site, does the concept exist, or any other relevant information?

replies.body:
There isn't a site that i have found as such but you can look yourself up during loading screen or during the actual match to see team MMRs. Average a few of your games to get an estimate. 
Hope this helps

I think that would be enough to satisfy his curiosity. 
Thank you!

Edit: Just to check, is the team MMR that comes up on say LolNexus queue specific, rather than going off your rank?

> I think that would be enough to satisfy his curiosity. 
> Thank you!
> 
> Edit: Just to check, is the team MMR that comes up on say LolNexus queue specific, rather than going off your rank?

Its obviously based off your solo queue rating. That's pretty much the only way to directly compare it to rank. Rank in aram means nothing though.

I get ARAM has a different MMR, and it's only a fun mode, so people don't try as hard. But...

Majority of his games are ARAM. 
He's wondering if the fact that an unranked is being consistently matched with plats and diamonds means that he may have similar mechanical skill to that of plat and diamond.

> He's wondering if the fact that an unranked is being consistently matched with plats and diamonds means that he may have similar mechanical skill to that of plat and diamond.

It could mean that he has skill similar to say gold but I doubt it would be as high as them. While ARAM does take some amount of skill it is a lot more luck based than other game modes. If the individuals in plat/diamond that your friend gets matched with/against use only 1 or 2 champs in ranked then chances are they wont have the skill to keep that same level of mmr in ARAM.

> I get ARAM has a different MMR, and it's only a fun mode, so people don't try as hard. But...
> 
> Majority of his games are ARAM. 
> He's wondering if the fact that an unranked is being consistently matched with plats and diamonds means that he may have similar mechanical skill to that of plat and diamond.

Sure, it's possible. But I'm sure a lot of plats/diamonds+ play ARAM for fun, and to take a break from ranked, while your friend might be playing to win. Why doesn't he just play ranked and see where he ends up?

Trying to encourage that, but he has the pre-ranked fear.
Feels like every game is worth so much, and that there's too much pressure.

Even normals are too serious for him :/.

Here's the thing, Their MMR in ARAM is probably %%%%, but if he is consistently playing BETTER then these plat's/diamonds, then he'd be decent in ranked (assuming he has the actual SR mechanics down half decently)

I also play mostly aram and get put in with plat+ alot but you aren't versing the player where they won that rank, we might be as good as that player playing aram on a champ they don't main but I know I wouldn't contend in lane against them. Alot of the fine mechanics that make a player stand out in ranked are lost in aram. Would be nice to see the MMR though.
Same. Silver to Diamond. I even had a challenger on my team twice lmao. Sometimes I'd be getting people higher then me on my team.
